sections.title: Wizard (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Wizard class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Wizard)
sections.description: Wizards are proficient with only a few simple weapons and no armor or shields, as armor interferes with spellcasting and can cause spells with somatic components to fail.

sections.title: Spells (Wizard)
sections.description: Wizards cast prepared arcane spells from the sorcerer/wizard spell list, requiring Intelligence scores and daily preparation through study of their spellbook.

sections.title: Bonus Languages (Wizard)
sections.description: A wizard may substitute Draconic for one of their racial bonus languages.

sections.title: Arcane Bond (Ex or Sp) (Wizard)
sections.description: At 1st level, wizards form a permanent bond with either a familiar or a bonded object that provides magical benefits and can be used to cast additional spells.

sections.title: Arcane School (Wizard)
sections.description: A wizard can specialize in one school of magic to gain additional spell slots and school powers, but must choose two opposition schools that require double spell slots to prepare.

sections.title: Elemental Arcane Schools (Wizard)
sections.description: Instead of a focused arcane school, wizards can specialize in elemental schools with only one opposed element rather than two opposition schools.

sections.title: Cantrips (Wizard)
sections.description: Wizards can prepare and cast 0-level spells called cantrips that are not expended when cast and may be used repeatedly.

sections.title: Scribe Scroll (Wizard)
sections.description: At 1st level, wizards automatically gain Scribe Scroll as a bonus feat without needing to meet prerequisites.

sections.title: Bonus Feats (Wizard)
sections.description: At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th level, wizards gain bonus feats from metamagic, item creation, or Spell Mastery categories, or can choose Arcane Discoveries instead.

sections.title: Well-Prepared (Su) (Wizard)
sections.description: At 20th level, wizards gain numerous additional spell slots per day across all spell levels, representing their mastery and preparedness.

sections.title: Adding Spells to a Wizard’s Spellbook (Wizard)
sections.anchor_heading: #### Adding Spells to a Wizard’s Spellbook {#adding_spells_to_a_wizard8217s_spellbook}
sections.description: Wizards can add new spells to their spellbooks through level advancement or by copying from scrolls and other spellbooks using Spellcraft checks.
